page.title: 01SWAFFHAM
page.content: Swaffham is a small market town in West Norfolk.It is situated on the crossing point of the A47 trunk road and the A1065. The block is a contrast of rural farmland and the town itself. The town is situated around a large Market Square, dominated by the Market Cross which is surmounted by the figure of Ceres.The buildings around the Square are mainly Georgian, although there are both older and more recent examples. On the highest part of the town, just off the Market Suare is the Fifteeth Century Church of S.S. Peter & Paul. To the South of the Square there is a mixture of residential, schools and factories, giving way to open fields and forests.
